article_title: China's Sinopec to Allow Foreign Investors
article_text:
BEIJING—China's largest oil refiner, which is in the process of opening up its lucrative fuel-marketing business to outside investors, will allow foreigners to participate in the transaction, state media reported Friday.

State-controlled China Petroleum & Chemical Corp., known as Sinopec, said last month it would allow outsiders to own up to 30% of its fuel-marketing business, which includes more than 30,000 gasoline stations. The announcement was applauded by many analysts and investors, and comes after Beijing...
